columns.text: This exercise requires us to determine the cash and current assets of the company.

First, let's define some important terms in the problem.

- **Net Working Capital** is the difference between a company's current assets and its current liabilities.
- **Cash** is the most liquid assets a company can own.
- **Current Assets** are all assets that a company expects to convert to cash within one year.

Next, let's identify the given amounts in the problem.

<center>

| |Amounts ($)| 
|--|--:| 
| Equity Value|13,315 | 
| Long Term Debt|8,200 | 
| Net Working Capital, other than cash| 2,750 | 
| Fixed Assets|17,380 | 
|Current Liabilities|2,025|

Before we compute the cash, let's first calculate the total net working capital. Note that you should always remember the accounting equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Assets} &= \text{Liabilities} + {\text{Equity}}\\[1pt]
\end{aligned}$$

To get the total net working capital, we will add the equity value and long term debt and deduct the fixed assets as solved below:

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Equity Value}&\$\hspace{5pt}\text{13,315}\\
\text{Long Term Debt}&\text{8,200} \\
\text{Less: Fixed Assets}&\underline{\hspace{14pt}\text{(17,380)}}\\
\text{Net Working Capital}&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\text{4,135}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Now that we have computed the total net working capital, let's now determine the cash of the company. Note that net working capital is equal to current assets less current liabilities and cash is part of current assets.

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Total Net Working Capital}&\$\hspace{5pt}\text{4,135}\\
\text{Net Working Capital, other than cash}&\underline{\hspace{14pt}\text{(2,750)}}\\
\textbf{Cash}&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\textbf{1,385}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Therefore, the total cash of the company is amounting to **$ 1,385.**

Current assets is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Currents Assets} &= \text{NWC} - {\text{CL}}\\[5pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Where: 

NWC - Net working Capital

CL - Current Liabilities

Lastly, we will now compute the total current assets of the company using the equation in step 7.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Currents Assets} &= \text{NWC} - {\text{CL}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{\$ 4,135} - {\text{\$ 2,025}}\\[5pt]
&= \underline{\underline{\textbf {\$ 2,110}}} 
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen, the current assets of the company are amounting to **$2,110.**
